required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Anthropometrics Data and of Physical Activity Level in Closed kineTic Chain Upper Extremity Stability Test
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Anthropometrics Data and of Physical Activity Level in Closed kineTic Chain Upper Extremity Stability Test (CKCUEST) - EPOLTEST Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate impact of anthropometric criteria to CKCUEST score.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This study is a monocentric interventional prospective study

primary_outcome.measure: Closed Kinetic Chain Upper Extremity Stability Test (CKCUEST) score
primary_outcome.description: Closed Kinetic Chain Upper Extremity Stability Test/ The CKCUEST is a functional test which assess shoulder's stability. Patient is in push-up position, with 91 cm between his hands. His body is straight and his foots are squeeze. patient has to touch his hand with his other one and returns in the initial position. Then, patient repeats this movement with his other hand, etc, during 15 secondes. The CKCUEST score is the movement's number performed. The outcome measure will be the mean of the three test realisation.

secondary_outcome.description: Global Physical Activity Questionnaire. It is a standardized questionnaire which evaluate the global physical activity. GPAQ takes into account both number and intensity of activity. There are 4 parts (profession activities,day to day ways of moving, hobbies, sedentarity) in total being 16 questions.

arm_group.arm_group_label: closed kineTic chain upper Extremity Stability Test
arm_group.description: Each patient receive the same intervention, the CKCUEST. The CKCUEST is a functional test which assess shoulder's stability. Patient is in push-up position, with 91 cm between his hands. His body is straight and his foots are squeeze. patient has to touch his hand with his other one and returns in the initial position. Then, patient repeats this movement with his other hand, etc, during 15 secondes. The CKCUEST score is the movement's number performed.

intervention.description: Each patient receive the same intervention, the CKCUEST. The CKCUEST is a functional test which assess shoulder's stability. Patient is in push-up position, with 91 cm between his hands. His body is straight and his foots are squeeze. patient has to touch his hand with his other one and returns in the initial position. Then, patient repeats this movement with his other hand, etc, during 15 secondes. The CKCUEST score is the movement's number performed.
intervention.arm_group_label: closed kineTic chain upper Extremity Stability Test

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged to 18 to 25 years
- Capacity to consent
- Who has signed the consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- fracture history or upper limb luxation
- is not possible to do the test because of pain
- pregnant or nursing
- refuse to participate
- guardianship or protection of vulnerable adult

patient_data.ipd_description: All collected data that underlie results in a publication
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will be available after the publication of result and ending fifteen years following the last visit of the last patient
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Data access requests will be reviewed by the internal committee of Brest University Hospital. Requestors will be required to sign and complete a data access agreement.
